text: remote standup for today!
I met with Justin King from King Estate Winery in Eugene on Friday. Had a really good chat (and had an opportunity to check out Urban Farmer’s new wine room that has some pretty neat tech in it).
Also learned that there’s someone in Portland with a three story wine cellar.
My asks are Sommely cap + Wine Rack related. Wanted to get a sense of what’s needed there to keep that moving.
I owe Shashi a note about the new 3D printed top - will get that out today.
Also need to work on follow-ups from my Marc meeting last week.
3 stories is a lot of wine
a tall pour
not installing a ladder would be an example of pour planning
uhg
:simple_smile:
I’m swamped today, so my input is going to be mostly advisory. I’ll jump in and work on packaging dependent on Lee’s successes today with USB BLE driver work.
if you fell off the ladder, you’d have a wine flight.

*got the edison hub working from boot on friday
*it maintained connection to 8 caps through the weekend with expected battery usage
*working on operating system optimization for the edison (smaller footprint-currently 1GB which is too big, needs drivers for extra bluetooth radios to support more caps)
*range for wifi (tablet to hub) is about 10 meters, same for caps to hub
we are on the border of make it work/optimization in the development tree (make it work/optimize/make it pretty)
wait that's wrong, it should be work/pretty/optimize, pretty is in parallel with work :simple_smile:
* Made the color wheel component and will add it to the site today.
Wasn't intel supposed to grab some devices for FCC testing?
ah will follow up to see if Shashi still needs. (The supposed delivery of additional OEI boards may have lessened it)
Answer is yes - OEI went dark again - will work w/ him to identify when he wants to pick them up
